column2: he had reached  the  state  of intoxication  in  which  he  could not have formed  a
murderous intention at the time of alleged act was done. "

column1: There  is  no  such plea raised  or such fact  proved on a  balance of probability on behalf of the

column2: accused  (1st Acc.used)  in the instant case.  Therefore I am of the  view that where an accused is
shown to  have entertained a particular intention after the  imputation of knowledge envisaged
should  be  convicted  of  the  offence  notwithstanding  his

column1: intoxication and he  is not covered under section 79 of the Penal Code.
